item.title: Expert Selections In MoE Models Reveal (Almost) As Much As Text
item.description: arXiv:2602.04105v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We present a text-reconstruction attack on mixture-of-experts (MoE) language models that recovers tokens from expert selections alone. In MoE models, each token is routed to a subset of expert subnetworks; we show these routing decisions leak substant...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> transformer, embedding, model, arxiv | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: KAG - KAG is a logical form-guided reasoning and retrieval framework based on OpenSPG engine and LLMs. It is used to build logical reasoning and factual Q&A solutions for professional domain knowledge bases. It can effectively overcome the shortcomings of the traditional RAG vector similarity calculation model.
item.description: KAG is a logical form-guided reasoning and retrieval framework based on OpenSPG engine and LLMs. It is used to build logical reasoning and factual Q&A solutions for professional domain knowledge bases. It can effectively overcome the shortcomings of the traditional RAG vector similarity calculation model.<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> GitHub | <strong>Keywords:</strong> reasoning, knowledge base, LLM, RAG, retrieval | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
